intro: Sprengelia patricia, commonly known as the purple orchid, is a species of orchid native to the rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant has a sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its leaves are typically elliptical and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Sprengelia patricia thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil for optimal growth.
